channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A 101-year-old runs the largest nutcracker museum in the U.S. Here's a look inside
item.description: Arlene Wagner has been collecting nutcrackers for nearly 50 years. Now, she's got one of the largest collections in the world, housed at the Leavenwor...

item.title: The GOP has allowed Trump to expand his authority. Here's where they're pushing back
item.description: Republicans in Congress have shown some willingness to push back on President Trump, but it is not clear how far they are willing to push back against...

item.title: Trump to address affordability. And, the significance of Indiana's redistricting fight
item.description: Trump travels to Pennsylvania to discuss America's affordability. And, Indiana lawmakers to vote on a congressional map that may eliminate the state's...

item.title: Are we in a recession? Maybe professional Santas can tell us
item.description: Demand for professional Santas and other seasonal workers seems to have cooled. Could that be a sign we're in a recession?

item.title: Black bear populations are bouncing back. Here's how these Texas towns are coping
item.description: Historically, Black bears were the biggest predator to travel the Big Bend area of Texas. But overhunting and habitat loss led to their decline.

item.title: Tanzania crackdown on planned protest leaves streets deserted
item.description: There is a large police presence in major cities and the authorities have encouraged people to stay home.

item.title: Democrats see Miami mayoral race as litmus test on Trump economy, immigration
item.description: National Democrats have deployed resources for County Commissioner Eileen Higgins, while Mr. Trump has endorsed former City Manager Emilio Gonzalez.

item.title: A Democrat takes on Trump-backed candidate for Miami mayor in a key Hispanic battleground
12/8: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: President Trump blasts Marjorie Taylor Greene after her "60 Minutes" interview; Supreme Court hears arguments over firing of FTC commissioner.

item.title: Jakarta office fire kills at least 22, police confirm
item.description: The blaze in the Indonesian capital breaks out as office workers take their lunch break.

item.title: Burkina Faso accuses Nigerian Air Force of violating its airspace
item.description: Nigeria denies the violation saying the aircraft made an emergency landing due to a technical issue.

item.title: Drone drops crab legs, steak and weed into notorious prison
item.description: A photo from the prison showed a raw steak, crab legs and Old Bay with side plastic baggies of marijuana and a couple of cartons of cigarettes.

item.title: EU investigates Google over AI-generated summaries in search results
item.description: It is examining whether the tech giant did not offer "appropriate compensation" to web publishers.

item.title: Nasa astronaut and cosmonauts return to Earth after 245 days in space
item.description: Nasa's Jonny Kim and cosmonauts Sergey Ryzhikov and Alexey Zubritsky have touched down in Earth after 245 days on the ISS.

item.title: DNC chair points to 2025 wins as a map out of the wilderness heading into midterms
item.description: "I won't feel like we're out of the wilderness until we win in '28," DNC Chairman Ken Martin told CBS News in the first in a series of interviews with...

item.title: ICE arrests of Afghans are on the rise in the wake of National Guard attack, immigration lawyers say
item.description: Immigration lawyers and authorities say arrests of Afghans are on the rise following the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C.

item.title: National Guardsman kills 3 fellow service members in Mexico
item.description: The shooting occurred hours after a car bomb exploded in Coahuayana, Michoacan, killing five people outside a local police station.

item.title: Trump’s attacks on Minnesota’s Somali community cast a spotlight on fraud cases
